intro: Denekia capensis, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has a fibrous root system. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Denekia capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils.
